results.title: An old box
results.creator_credit: Gaston Sarault, ONF | NFB and Paul Driessen
results.brief_description: An animated story of a beggar who repairs an old box, in order to set it up and ask for donations. As he stands in the street he gets cold, so he climbs into the box to keep warm. At once a spectacular star descends from the sky to the box and when it returns to the sky, it takes with it the ghost of the beggar. A film without words. (Awards: Chicago; San Franscisco; Melbourne; Dubuque: Los Angeles; Les Menuires.)

results.title: An Officer and a gentleman
results.creator_credit: Martin Elfand, Paramount Pictures, Lorimar Film Entertainment and Taylor Hackford
results.brief_description: Taylor Hackford (Against all odds, Proof of life) directed “An Officer and a gentleman”, starring Richard Gere and Debra Winger. It is the story of Zack Mayo (Gere) a man of uncertain future who is in conflict with his identity. A life of familial instability has left Zack unwilling to engage emotionally with others, especially women. Zack determines that he favours a career as a navy pilot, largely to prove to his alcoholic father that he is a son worthy of respect and capable of achievement. His steely demeanour suits military life but is in part broken down by his romance with a local factory girl Paula Pokrifi (Winger). Life in the armed forces is depicted as brutal and inhumane as the recruits make their way through a gruelling 13-week course. Foley, (Louis Gossett, Jnr) the irascible Major in charge of the recruits, rides Mayo particularly hard as he recognises in him Officer material. Mayo is torn between his cold conduct that shelters him from feeling anything and his burgeoning love for Paula. “An Officer and a gentleman” won Oscars for Gosset (Best Supporting Actor) and Best Song for “Up where we belong”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Elfand, Paramount Pictures, Lorimar Film Entertainment and Taylor Hackford

results.title: An Occurrence at Owl Creek Bridge
results.creator_credit: Robert Enrico, Filmartic, Films du Centaure, Marcel Ichac and Paul de Roubaix
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of a short story by Ambrose Bierce set during the American Civil War in which a Confederate citizen stands on the scaffold, about to be hanged, and seems, as by a series of miracles, to escape death.

results.title: An Italian family: life on a farm
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film presents geographic and cultural aspects of Italy with an account of one family living on a small farm, who, unlike many Italians seeking modernisation, avoid mechanisation in preference for a simple way of life. With collaboration by Edoardo Capolino.

results.title: An Island nation: Japan
results.creator_credit: Victor Jurgens and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
Life in urban and rural Japan, showing the customs and work of a Japanese farm family as observed by their young cousin from the city. Shows how this country of 80,000,000 people, handicapped by mountainous terrain and without the necessary raw materials for industrial development, has done to overcome her difficulties. Japan’s industry is based on the importation of raw materials and the selling of finished products throughout the world, made possible by low wages and long hours of work. In rural areas, people work long and hard to gain a livelihood from the soil.

results.title: An Irish Medley 423
results.brief_description: Englishman Reginald Foot plays and sings ten Irish national melodies such as Londonderry Air, Killarney and St Patrick’s Day which are paired with scenes of rural Ireland.

results.title: An Invitation to Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the tourist attractions found along Japan’s most representative travel route: Tokyo, Nikko, Kamakura, Hakone, Kyoto, Nara, Osaka, highlighting such places as the Great Buddha at Kamakura, the Olympic Games site and the Toshogu Shrine at Nikko. Also shows typical Japanese food, pearls, kimonos, porcelain and textiles.

results.title: An Introduction to visual illusions (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Stanley Halls, Caldwell-Halls Productions and John Caldwell
results.brief_description: Professor Joseph Lyons explains the functions of the eye and the brain in perception, how the brain collates information about distance, perspective and movement. A variety of ingenious film techniques are used to illustrate visual illusions.

results.title: An Introduction to vectors: coplanar concurrent forces
results.creator_credit: Loucks and Norling Studios and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: Explains the meaning of scalar and vector quantities; how to add scalars and vectors; methods of vector composition and vector resolution; relationship between vector composition and vector resolution; and how vectors may be used to solve engineering problems.
